titleStmt.title: Bridge Phase 2: Witness fMS, Collation unit C28

availability.licence: Distributed under a Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 3.0 Unported License

body.ab:
<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0132__main__3"/>We
had resolved not
to
go
to
London
<lb n="c57-0132__main__4"/>but <del loc="c57-0132__main__d1e21749__Start"/>to
go<del loc="c57-0132__main__d1e21749__End"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>tocross
the country to
Portsmouth
<lb n="c57-0132__main__5"/>and
<del loc="c57-0132__main__d1e21762__Start"/>from<del loc="c57-0132__main__d1e21762__End"/>
thence to embark
to
Havre.
I
<lb n="c57-0132__main__6"/>preferred this
<del loc="c57-0132__main__d1e21767__Start"/>pan<del loc="c57-0132__main__d1e21767__End"/>
plan principally because <lb n="c57-0132__main__7"/>I dreaded
to
see again those places
in
which
<lb n="c57-0132__main__8"/>I
had enjoyed a few moments of tranquilli<lb n="c57-0132__main__9"/>ty with
my
beloved
Cl<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>erval –
And
I
thought <lb n="c57-0132__main__10"/>with horror of seeing
those
men
whom <lb n="c57-0132__main__11"/>we had been accustomed to visit
together
<lb n="c57-0132__main__12"/>and
who, doubtless, would
make
enquiries
<lb n="c57-0132__main__13"/>concerning an
event
the very remembrance <lb n="c57-0132__main__14"/>of which made me again feel
what
I <lb n="c57-0132__main__15"/>endured when I gazed on his lifeless
form.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0132__main__16"/>As
for my
father;
his desires
&exer<lb n="c57-0132__main__17"/>tions
were bounded to
the
again seeing <lb n="c57-0132__main__18"/>me
<del loc="c57-0132__main__d1e21824__Start"/>res<del loc="c57-0132__main__d1e21824__End"/>
restored to health
and
peace of <lb n="c57-0132__main__19"/>mind. His tenderness & attentions were
<lb n="c57-0132__main__20"/>unremitting,
my
grief
and
gloom was
obsti<lb n="c57-0132__main__21"/>nate
but he would not
despair. Some<lb n="c57-0132__main__22"/>times he thought that I felt deeply <lb n="c57-0132__main__23"/>the degradation of being obliged to answer <lb n="c57-0132__main__24"/>a charge of
murder
and he endeavoured <lb n="c57-0132__main__25"/>to prove to me the futility
of
pride. <lb n="c57-0132__main__26"/>Alas!
my
father,
said I,
how
little do you <lb n="c57-0132__main__27"/>know
me:
human beings, their feelings <lb n="c57-0132__main__28"/>and
passions
would indeed be
degraded
<lb n="c57-0132__main__29"/>if such a wretch as I felt pride.
Justine
<lb n="c57-0132__main__30"/>poor unhappy
Justine
was as innocent <lb n="c57-0132__main__31"/>as
I
and she suffered the same
charge,
<lb n="c57-0132__main__32"/>she died for
it –
And I am the cause <lb n="c57-0132__main__33"/>of
this – I
murdered her.
William<lb n="c57-0133__main__1"/>Justine
&
Henry, they
all died by my
hand<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0133__main__2"/>My
father had
often
during my
<lb n="c57-0133__main__3"/>late confinement
heard me make the <lb n="c57-0133__main__4"/>same
Assertion & his astonishment <lb n="c57-0133__main__5"/>was extreme.
When
I<del loc="c57-0133__main__d1e21917__Start"/>heard me<del loc="c57-0133__main__d1e21917__End"/>thus<del loc="c57-0133__main__d1e21923__Start"/>thus<del loc="c57-0133__main__d1e21923__End"/> ac
<lb n="c57-0133__main__6"/>accused myself, he sometimes seemed to
desire<lb n="c57-0133__main__7"/>an explanation
& at others he appeared <lb n="c57-0133__main__8"/>to consider it as
caused by
delirium &<lb n="c57-0133__main__9"/>that <del loc="c57-0133__main__d1e21943__Start"/>some idea<del loc="c57-0133__main__d1e21943__End"/>
during my
illness
some <lb n="c57-0133__main__10"/>idea of this kind had presented itself <lb n="c57-0133__main__11"/>to my
imagination <del loc="c57-0133__main__d1e21950__Start"/>t<del loc="c57-0133__main__d1e21950__End"/><del loc="c57-0133__main__d1e21953__Start"/>an<del loc="c57-0133__main__d1e21953__End"/>
the
remembe<lb n="c57-0133__main__12"/>rance
of which I preserved in my conva<lb n="c57-0133__main__13"/>lescence. <del loc="c57-0133__main__d1e21969__Start"/>I<del loc="c57-0133__main__d1e21969__End"/> avoided
explanation; I
main<lb n="c57-0133__main__14"/>tained a continual silence concerning <lb n="c57-0133__main__15"/>the wretch I had created. I had a
feeling
<lb n="c57-0133__main__16"/>that I should be supposed
mad
and this
<lb n="c57-0133__main__17"/>for ever
chained
my
tongue
when I <lb n="c57-0133__main__18"/>would have given the
whole
world to <lb n="c57-0133__main__19"/>have confided the fatal
secret.
Up<lb n="c57-0133__main__20"/>on these occasions
my father
said
with <lb n="c57-0133__main__21"/>an expression of unbounded
wonder <lb n="c57-0133__main__22"/>What
do you mean,
Victor,
are you mad?
<lb n="c57-0133__main__23"/>My dear son, I entreat you
not
to make
<lb n="c57-0133__main__24"/>so strange
an assertion
again.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0133__main__25"/>I
am not
mad,
I cried
energetically, <lb n="c57-0133__main__26"/>the
sun & the
heavens
who have view<lb n="c57-0133__main__27"/>ed my
operations
can bear witness of <lb n="c57-0133__main__28"/>my truth. I
was
the assassin of those <lb n="c57-0133__main__29"/>most innocent
victims —
they died by my <lb n="c57-0133__main__30"/>machinations. A thousand times would <lb n="c57-0133__main__31"/>I
<del loc="c57-0133__main__d1e22039__Start"/>rather<del loc="c57-0133__main__d1e22039__End"/>
have shed my own
blood
<lb n="c57-0133__main__32"/>drop
<del loc="c57-0133__main__d1e22045__Start"/>d<del loc="c57-0133__main__d1e22045__End"/>
by
drop
to have saved their
lives:<lb n="c57-0133__main__33"/>But
I could not, my father, indeed
I<lb n="c57-0134__main__1"/>could
not sacrifice the whole human
race.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0134__main__2"/>The
conclusion of this speech
persuaded
my <lb n="c57-0134__main__3"/>father that my ideas were
deranged –
and
byinstant<lb n="c57-0134__main__4"/>ly changing
the subject of our
conversation he<lb n="c57-0134__main__5"/>endeavoured
to alter the course of my thoughts. <lb n="c57-0134__main__6"/>He wished as much as possible to obliterate the <lb n="c57-0134__main__7"/>memory of the scenes
in
Ireland
and never
<lb n="c57-0134__main__8"/>again
alluded to
them
or suffered me to speak <lb n="c57-0134__main__9"/>of my
misfortunes. As
time passed away I became <lb n="c57-0134__main__10"/>more
calm;
misery had her dwelling in my
<lb n="c57-0134__main__11"/>heart
but I no longer talked in the same incoherent <lb n="c57-0134__main__12"/>manner
<del loc="c57-0134__main__d1e22112__Start"/>I before did<del loc="c57-0134__main__d1e22112__End"/>
of my own crimes; suffi<lb n="c57-0134__main__13"/>cient for me was the consciousness of them. <lb n="c57-0134__main__14"/>By the utmost
self violence
I curbed the <lb n="c57-0134__main__15"/>imperious voice of
wretchedness
which
<lb n="c57-0134__main__16"/>desired
sometimes
to declare itself to the <lb n="c57-0134__main__17"/>whole
world,
& my manners were calmer <lb n="c57-0134__main__18"/>& more composed than they had ever been <lb n="c57-0134__main__19"/>since my journey to
the Sea of Ice. Even <lb n="c57-0134__main__20"/>my father who watched me as the bird <lb n="c57-0134__main__21"/>does its <del loc="c57-0134__main__d1e22139__Start"/>n<del loc="c57-0134__main__d1e22139__End"/> nestling was deceived and thought <lb n="c57-0134__main__22"/>that the black melancholy which had <lb n="c57-0134__main__23"/>oppressed me was quitting me for ever <lb n="c57-0134__main__24"/>and that my native country
&
the
society
<lb n="c57-0134__main__25"/>of
my friends would entirely restore me to <lb n="c57-0134__main__26"/>my former health & vivacity.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0134__main__27"/>We
arrived at Havre on the
8th<lb n="c57-0134__main__28"/>of <del loc="c57-0134__main__d1e22166__Start"/>February<del loc="c57-0134__main__d1e22166__End"/>May&
instantly proceeded
to
Paris
<lb n="c57-0134__main__29"/>where my father had some
business
<lb n="c57-0134__main__30"/>which detained
<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>us
a few weeks.
<del loc="c57-0134__main__d1e22187__Start"/>I I rermain<del loc="c57-0134__main__d1e22187__End"/><lb n="c57-0134__main__31"/><del loc="c57-0134__main__d1e22192__Start"/>ed<del loc="c57-0134__main__d1e22192__End"/><del loc="c57-0134__main__d1e22195__Start"/>with<del loc="c57-0134__main__d1e22195__End"/><del loc="c57-0134__main__d1e22198__Start"/>him.<del loc="c57-0134__main__d1e22198__End"/>
In this
city
I received the <lb n="c57-0134__main__32"/>following letter from
Elizabeth:
